meanings.definition: The alternation of sexual and asexual generations in the life cycle of an organism.
meanings.sent1: Metagenesis is when an organism changes between different types of reproduction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study metagenesis to understand how organisms reproduce in different ways.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was full of laughter when the biology teacher explained metagenesis using funny drawings.
meanings.sent4: In the life of a plant, metagenesis is like a dance between two partners, each taking turns leading.
meanings.sent5: The concept of metagenesis can be as complex as a puzzle, but once solved, it reveals a beautiful picture of life's diversity.

meanings.definition: The production of new individuals by the alteration of generations.
meanings.sent1: Metagenesis results in the creation of fresh offspring through the changing of generations.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use metagenesis to improve the quality of crops by selecting the best generations for breeding.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the monkeys seemed to have their own metagenesis plan, passing the banana-eating skills from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent4: In a way, metagenesis is like a relay race where each generation passes the baton of life to the next runner.
meanings.sent5: The magic of metagenesis is like a never-ending storybook, with each generation adding a new chapter to the tale of life.
